description: Caper (Capparis spinosa var. inermis) is an evergreen shrub native to the Mediterranean region and Middle East. It is an amazing plant for its incredible myriad of uses. Its stems and leaves can be used for medicinal purposes, and is even an ingredient in pharmaceutical drugs. Its buds are used to make the popular condiment, capers, and can also be used to make a flavorful sauce for fish dishes. Its flowers are beautiful, and the mature fruit are dark purple-black in color. Caper is an incredibly hardy and resilient plant, thriving in dry and salty conditions, making it an excellent choice for xeriscaping or for ornamental plantings. This amazing plant is both medicinal, edible, and aesthetically pleasing, making it an ideal choice for any environment.
